Seebak mn ay 7aga, Ahm 7aga eb3ed 3n magento w 5las :D

I prefer WooCommerce, it's wordPress based, easy to use and common than opencart. You can use Avada Theme for WooCommerce website, but should Magento is the best ecommerce platform if you have experience in.

Small stores typically use WooCommerce or Shopify. They pick a theme, install marketing plugins, and they start selling:
http://store.fut-electronics.com/ (Shopify)
https://www.jozeeboutique.com/ (WooCommerce)

Medium stores typically use Woocommerce (or other WordPress plugins) or OpenCart (it is multi-lingual built in). It is worth nothing that the top "digital products, hardware products for medium enterprises" that I know of in Egypt are all built using OpenCart:
https://www.computershopegypt.com/
https://compume.com.eg/

For Enterprise stores with much larger number of products, Magento is typically used, but it's much harder to setup and not as user friendly for data entry:
http://www.rayashop.com/
http://www.hedeya.com/

Note: I use https://wappalyzer.com/ to detect the cms/framework/tools used on websites as I browse online.

small and medium : opencart,woocommerce - based on your store requirement 
Enterprise Store : Magento
